title.narrative: UNOPS Rural Access Improvement Project III
UNOPS Rural Access Improvement Project III

description.narrative: Overall objective of the project is to contribute to reduction of poverty in rural areas, bridgedisparities between urban and rural areas and support the GoA's efforts towards equitable growth.Project purposes are to: i) increase and sustain accessibility to social services and market centres inthe project area, ii) develop road construction and maintenance capacity and iii) create employmentopportunities.

RAIP III i Afghanistans norra provinser (Balkh, Jowjan, Samangan och Sar-e-Pul) är ett vägprojekt innehållande vägrehabilitering och underhåll, kapacitetsutveckling och skapande av sysselsättning under 2013-2015 till ett belopp om 199 MSEK inklusive 1 MSEK avsatt för Sidas uppföljning.

RAIP III in the Northern provinces of Afghanistan includes the following activites i) road rehabilitation and maintenance, ii) capacity development and iii) employment creation during the period 2013 - 2015. The budget amounts to 199 MSEK including 1 MSEK allocated for Sia's monitoring.

participating-org.narrative: UNOPS/United Nations Office for Project Services
United Nations Office for Project Services

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Note 1: Final Completion Report of RAIP III (May 2013-Oct 2016) was submitted by UNOPS 2017-03-28, and following corrections/updates subsequently approved by Sida (Bengt Ekman) 2017-03-30. Note 2: “Final Audited Certified Financial Report” has been delayed from UNOPS due to their difficulties to find an auditor willing to travel to project because of the difficult security situation. Final Financial Audit Report of RAIP III was submitted 2018-10-11 covering period between 1 January 2015 to 30 June 2018. The result achieved at the end of project is summarized as follows: -Routine maintenance was carried in 1,641 km of gravel surface roads and 209 km bituminous sealed surface road as well as snow clearance in 95 km section in project periods. The routine maintenance and snow clearance supported to keep the road opened for traffic throughout a year in project area; -206 km of secondary road was undertaken periodic maintenance. 111 km of secondary road and 176 km of tertiary road were constructed/rehabilitated. 3.7 km of gravel road was upgraded into bituminous sealed surface. Travel time was reduced by more than 50% due to construction and maintenance of roads; -Road maintenance management system was piloted in project and presented to national and provincial level. PWD and RRD engineers were trained to build their capacity in Road maintenance system for the sustainability of road maintenance; -Total 492 persons were trained under the capacity building activities. Recent university graduates, practicing engineers, government officials, community leaders and private contractors are equipped with the necessary professional skills and techniques to handle responsibilities; -All the recurrent works were implemented through community shura. Community Shura living in project area were able to undertake routine maintenance for secondary and tertiary roads; -67 Women’s groups involving 1572 members developed skills and undertake entrepreneurial income-generating activities; -165 small infrastructure projects requested by communities were delivered through the RAIP Infrastructure Support Fund; -515,330 men labour days and 126,764 women labour days of paid work were generated by direct employment from project activities.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
